errors.error_description: The conda installation command `conda install jupyter-qtconsole` is incorrect; the package name is `qtconsole`.
correction_candidates: conda install -c conda-forge qtconsole
conda install qtconsole
conda install jupyter_qtconsole
pip install jupyter-qtconsole

errors.error_description: The command `pip install python-qt5` is incorrect for installing PyQt5. The correct package name on PyPI is `pyqt5`.
correction_candidates: pip install PyQt5
conda install pyqt5
pip install pyqt5
pip install pyside6

errors.error_description: The README incorrectly states that qtconsole is only compatible with PyQt4, which is outdated information. It is compatible with PyQt5, PySide2, PyQt6, and PySide6.
correction_candidates: Change the text to: "The Qtconsole requires Python bindings for Qt. It is recommended to use PyQt5 or PySide2."
Change the text to: "The Qtconsole is compatible with PyQt5, PyQt6, PySide2, and PySide6."

Restore the original sentence: "The Qtconsole requires Python bindings for Qt, such as [PyQt6](https://pypi.org/project/PyQt6/), [PySide6](https://pypi.org/project/PySide6/), [PyQt5](https://pypi.org/project/PyQt5/) or [PySide2](https://pypi.org/project/PySide2/)."
Remove the sentence entirely.
errors.golden_answer: Restore the original sentence: "The Qtconsole requires Python bindings for Qt, such as [PyQt6](https://pypi.org/project/PyQt6/), [PySide6](https://pypi.org/project/PySide6/), [PyQt5](https://pypi.org/project/PyQt5/) or [PySide2](https://pypi.org/project/PySide2/)."

errors.error_description: The instructions for `pip` installation are in the wrong logical order. It suggests running qtconsole before confirming its dependencies are installed, which will cause an error.
correction_candidates: Restore the original text: "**Note:** Make sure that Qt is installed. Unfortunately, Qt is not installed when using pip. The next section gives instructions on doing it."
Add the command `pip install pyqt5` before `pip install qtconsole`.
Change the section to recommend installing with conda instead.
Combine the installation into one line: `pip install qtconsole pyqt5`.
errors.golden_answer: Restore the original text: "**Note:** Make sure that Qt is installed. Unfortunately, Qt is not installed when using pip. The next section gives instructions on doing it."

errors.error_description: The image link for the qtconsole screenshot is broken due to an incorrect path, which omits the `/source` directory.
correction_candidates: Change the image path to `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jupyter/qtconsole/main/docs/source/_images/qtconsole.png`.
Change the image path to `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jupyter/qtconsole/master/docs/source/_images/qtconsole.png`.
Change the image path to point to the documentation: `https://qtconsole.readthedocs.io/en/stable/_images/qtconsole.png`.
Remove the image line entirely.

errors.error_description: The command to run the application, `jupyter-qtconsole`, is incorrect. The correct command is `jupyter qtconsole`.
correction_candidates: Change the command to `jupyter-console`.
Change the command to `jupyter qtconsole`.
Change the command to `ipython qtconsole`.
Change the command to `python -m qtconsole`.

errors.error_description: The conda installation guide incorrectly states that the Qt requirement is not automatically installed, leading to an unnecessary, separate `conda install pyqt5` command.
correction_candidates: Restore the original text: "**Note:** If the Qtconsole is installed using conda, it will **automatically** install the Qt requirement as well." and remove the `conda install pyqt5` command.
Change the command to `conda install qtconsole pyqt5`.
Change the text to: "**Note:** Conda may install the Qt requirement, but it is best to install it explicitly."
Change the command to `conda install qtconsole -c conda-forge`.
errors.golden_answer: Restore the original text: "**Note:** If the Qtconsole is installed using conda, it will **automatically** install the Qt requirement as well." and remove the `conda install pyqt5` command.

errors.error_description: A critical note explaining that `pip` does not automatically install the Qt dependency has been removed, making the instructions unclear and likely to fail for users.
correction_candidates: Add the note back: "**Note:** Make sure that Qt is installed. Unfortunately, Qt is not installed when using pip. The next section gives instructions on doing it."
Change the `pip install qtconsole` command to `pip install qtconsole[pyqt5]`.
Add a sentence: "After this, you must install a Qt binding like PyQt5 separately."
Add a link to the "Installing Qt" section right after the command.
errors.golden_answer: Add the note back: "**Note:** Make sure that Qt is installed. Unfortunately, Qt is not installed when using pip. The next section gives instructions on doing it."
